airport

Class Airport

  • java.lang.Object
    • airport.Airport
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Airport>, java.util.Comparator<Airport>

    public class Airport
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Airport>, java.util.Comparator<Airport>
    This class holds values pertaining to a single Airport. Class member attributes are the same as defined by the CS509 server API and store values after conversion from XML received from the server to Java primitives. Attributes are accessed via getter and setter methods.
    Since:
    2016-02-24
    Version:
    1.2
    Author:
    blake

    • Constructor Detail

      • Airport

        public Airport()
        Default constructor Constructor without params. Requires object fields to be explicitly set using setter methods
        Precondition
        None
        Postcond
        member attributes are initialized to invalid default values

      • Airport

        public Airport(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String code,
               double latitude,
               double longitude)
        Initializing constructor. All attributes are initialized with input values
        Parameters:
        name - The human readable name of the airport
        code - The 3 letter code for the airport
        latitude - The north/south coordinate of the airport
        longitude - The east/west coordinate of the airport
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is any parameter is invalid
        Precondition
        code is a 3 character string, name is not empty, latitude and longitude are valid values
        Postcond
        member attributes are initialized with input parameter values

      • Airport

        public Airport(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String code,
               java.lang.String latitude,
               java.lang.String longitude)
        Initializing constructor with all params as type String. Converts latitude and longitude values to required double format.
        Parameters:
        name - The human readable name of the airport
        code - The 3 letter code for the airport
        latitude - is the string representation of latitude decimal format
        longitude - is the String representation of the longitude in decimal format
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - is any parameter is invalid
        Precondition
        the latitude and longitude are valid String representations of valid lat/lon values
        Postcond
        member attributes are initialized with input parameter values

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Airport other)
        Compare two airports based on 3 character code This implementation delegates to the case insensitive version of string compareTo
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Airport>
        Returns:
        results of String.compareToIgnoreCase

      • compare

        public int compare(Airport airport1,
                   Airport airport2)
        Compare two airports for sorting, ordering Delegates to airport1.compareTo for ordering by 3 character code
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<Airport>
        Parameters:
        airport1 - the first airport for comparison
        airport2 - the second / other airport for comparison
        Returns:
        -1 if airport ordered before airport2, +1 of airport1 after airport2, zero if no different in order

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Determine if two airport objects are the same airport Compare another object to this airport and return true if the other object specifies the same airport as this object
        Specified by:
        equals in interface java.util.Comparator<Airport>
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - is the object to compare against this object
        Returns:
        true if the param is the same airport as this, else false

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Determine if object instance has valid attribute data Verifies the name is not null and not an empty string. Verifies code is 3 characters in length. Verifies latitude is between +90.0 north pole and -90.0 south pole. Verifies longitude is between +180.0 east prime meridian and -180.0 west prime meridian.
        Returns:
        true if object passes above validation checks

      • isValidCode

        public boolean isValidCode(java.lang.String code)
        Check for invalid 3 character airport code
        Parameters:
        code - is the airport code to validate
        Returns:
        false if null or not 3 characters in length, else assume valid and return true

      • isValidName

        public boolean isValidName(java.lang.String name)

        Parameters:
        name - is the name of the airport to validate
        Returns:
        false if null or empty string, else assume valid and return true
